alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Boyd, southwestern Greenup and Carter Counties through 100 AM EST... At 1208 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Triplett, or 9 miles west of Olive Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grayson, Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Coalton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Rush, Carter, Grahn, Hopewell, Hitchins, Warnock and Globe. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
